  118: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  119: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  120: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  121: 
  122: %% suite() ->
  123: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  124: 
  125: suite() ->
  126:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  127: 
  128: all() ->
  129:     [
  130:      {group, openssh},
  131:      small_interrupted_send,
  132:      interrupted_send,
  133:      exec_erlang_term,
  134:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  135:      exec_disabled,
  136:      exec_shell_disabled,
  137:      start_shell,
  138:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  139:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  140:      trap_exit_connect,
  141:      trap_exit_daemon,
  142:      start_shell_pty,
  143:      start_shell_exec,
  144:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  145:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  146:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  147:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  148:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  149:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  150:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data,
  151:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  152:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  153:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  154:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  155:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  156:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  157:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  158:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  159:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  160:      connect2_invalid_options,
  161:      connect_invalid_port,
  162:      connect_invalid_options,
  163:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  164:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  165:      connect3_invalid_port,
  166:      connect3_invalid_options,
  167:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  168:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  169:      connect3_invalid_both,
  170:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  171:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  172:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  173:      connect4_invalid_three,
  174:      connect_timeout,
  175:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  176:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  177:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  178:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  179:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  180:      kex_error,
  181:      stop_listener,
  182:      no_sensitive_leak,
  183:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  184:      max_channels_option,
  185:      handler_down_before_open
  186:     ].
  187: groups() ->
  188:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  189: 
  190: payload() ->
  191:     [simple_exec,
  192:      simple_exec_more_data,
  193:      simple_exec_sock,
  194:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  195:      small_cat,
  196:      big_cat,
  197:      send_after_exit].
  198: 
  199: ptty() ->
  200:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  201:      ptty_alloc,
  202:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  203: 
  204: sock() ->
  205:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  206:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  207:     ].
  208: 
  209: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  210: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  211:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  212:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  213:         | Config]
  214:       ).
  215: 
  216: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  217:     catch ssh:stop(),
  218:     ok.
  219: 
  220: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  221: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  222:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  223: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  224: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  225: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  226: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  227: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  228:     end;
  229: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  230:     Config.
  231: 
  232: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  233:     Config.
  234: 
  235: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  236: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  237:     ssh:stop(),
  238:     ssh:start(),
  239:     {ok, TestLogHandlerRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  240:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config),
  241:     [{log_handler_ref, TestLogHandlerRef} | Config].
  242: 
  243: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  244:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(
  245:                      proplists:get_value(log_handler_ref, Config)),
  246:     EventCnt = length(Events),
  247:     {ok, InterestingEventCnt} = analyze_events(Events, EventCnt),
  248:     VerificationResult = verify_events(TestCase, InterestingEventCnt),
  249:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  250:     ssh:stop(),
  251:     VerificationResult.
  252: 
  253: analyze_events(_, 0) ->
  254:     {ok, 0};
  255: analyze_events(Events, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0 ->
  256:     {ok, Cnt} = print_interesting_events(Events, 0),
  257:     case Cnt > 0 of
  258:         true ->
  259:             ct:comment("(logger stats) interesting: ~p boring: ~p",
  260:                        [Cnt, EventNumber - Cnt]);
  261:         _ ->
  262:             ct:comment("(logger stats) boring: ~p",
  263:                        [length(Events)])
  264:     end,
  265:     AllEventsSummary = lists:flatten([process_event(E) || E <- Events]),
  266:     ct:log("~nTotal logger events: ~p~nAll events:~n~s", [EventNumber, AllEventsSummary]),
  267:     {ok, Cnt}.
  268: 
  269: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  270:                         #{label := Label,
  271:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  272:                                      {Status, Properties}]}},
  273:                 level := Level}) ->
  274:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  275: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  276:                         #{label := Label,
  277:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  278:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  279:                                      {reason, {Status, _ReasonDetails}},
  280:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  281:                 level := Level}) ->
  282:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  283: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  284:                         #{label := Label,
  285:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  286:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  287:                                      {reason, Status},
  288:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  289:                 level := Level}) ->
  290:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  291: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  292:                         #{label := Label,
  293:                           report := [Properties, []]}},
  294:                 level := Level}) ->
  295:     {status, Status} = get_value(status, Properties),
  296:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  297:     Id = get_value(registered_name, Properties),
  298:     {initial_call, {M, F, Args}} = get_value(initial_call, Properties),
  299:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s)~n",
  300:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  301:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args]]);
  302: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  303:                         #{label := Label,
  304:                           name := Pid,
  305:                           reason := {Reason, _Stack = [{M, F, Args, Location} | _]}}},
  306:                 level := Level}) ->
  307:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~30s~n",
  308:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  309:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Reason, undefined, M, F, Args, Location]]);
  310: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  311:                         #{label := Label,
  312:                          format := Format,
  313:                          args := Args}},
  314:                 meta := #{pid := Pid},
  315:                 level := Level}) ->
  316:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~150s~n",
  317:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  318:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label]] ++ [io_lib:format(Format, Args)]);
  319: process_event(E) ->
  320:     io_lib:format("~n||RAW event||~n~p~n", [E]).
  321: 
  322: format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level) ->
  323:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  324:     Id = get_value(id, Properties),
  325:     {M, F, Args} = get_mfa_value(Properties),
  326:     RestartType = get_value(restart_type, Properties),
  327:     Significant = get_value(significant, Properties),
  328:     io_lib:format("[~30s <- ~10s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~20s ~25s~n",
  329:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  330:                       E <- [Supervisor, Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args,
  331:                             Significant, RestartType]]).
  332: 
  333: get_mfa_value(Properties) ->
  334:     case get_value(mfargs, Properties) of
  335:         {mfargs, MFA} ->
  336:             MFA;
  337:         false ->
  338:             {mfa, MFA} = get_value(mfa, Properties),
  339:             MFA
  340:     end.
  341: 
  342: get_value(Key, List) ->
  343:     case lists:keyfind(Key, 1, List) of
  344:         R = false ->
  345:             ct:log("Key ~p not found in~n~p", [Key, List]),
  346:             R;
  347:         R -> R
  348:     end.
  349: 
  350: print_interesting_events([], Cnt) ->
  351:     {ok, Cnt};
  352: print_interesting_events([#{level := Level} = Event | Tail], Cnt)
  353:   when Level /= info, Level /= notice ->
  354:     ct:log("------------~nInteresting event found:~n~p~n==========~n", [Event]),
  355:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt + 1);
  356: print_interesting_events([_|Tail], Cnt) ->
  357:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt).
  358: 
  359: verify_events(_TestCase, 0) -> ok;
  360: verify_events(no_sensitive_leak, 1) -> ok;
  361: verify_events(max_channels_option, 3) -> ok;
  362: verify_events(_TestCase, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0->
  363:     {fail, lists:flatten(
  364:              io_lib:format("unexpected event cnt: ~s",
  365:                            [integer_to_list(EventNumber)]))}.
  366: 
  367: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  368: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  369: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  370: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  371:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  372:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  373: 
  374: simple_exec_more_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  376:     %% more data received, SSH window adjust needs to be sent by client
  377:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 60000).
  378: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  379: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  380:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  381:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  382:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  383:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  384:                                             ]),
  385:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  386: 
  387: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  388: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  389:     Parent = self(),
  390:     F = fun() ->
  391:                 spawn_link(
  392:                   fun() ->
  393:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  394:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  395:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  396:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  397:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  398:                   end)
  399:         end,
  400:     Pid1 = F(),
  401:     Pid2 = F(),
  402:     receive
  403:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  404:     end,
  405:     receive
  406:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  407:     end.
  408: 
  409: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  410: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  411:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  412: 
  413: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  414:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  415: 
  416: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  417:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  418: 
  419: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  420:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  421:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  422: 
  423: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  424:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  425:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  426: 
  427: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  428:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  429:     {error, _Reason} =
  430:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  431: 
  432: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  433:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  434: 
  435:     {error, invalid_port} =
  436:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  437:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  438:                      {user, "foo"},
  439:                      {password, "morot"},
  440:                      {user_interaction, false},
  441:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  442:                     infinity),
  443: 
  444:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  445: 
  446: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  447:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  448: 
  449:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  450:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  451:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  452:                      {user, "foo"},
  453:                      {password, "morot"},
  454:                      {user_interaction, false},
  455:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  456:                    longer),
  457: 
  458:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  459: 
  460: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  461:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  462: 
  463:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  464:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  465:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  466:                      {user, "foo"},
  467:                      {password, "morot"},
  468:                      {user_interaction, false},
  469:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  470:                    -1),
  471: 
  472:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  473: 
  474: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  475:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  476: 
  477:     {error, invalid_options} =
  478:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  479:                     {user, "foo"},
  480:                     infinity),
  481: 
  482:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  483: 
  484: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  485: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  486:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  487: 
  488:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  489:     {error, _} =
  490:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  491:                     {user, "foo"},
  492:                     infinity),
  493: 
  494:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  495: 
  496: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  497:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  498: 
  499:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  500:     {error, _} =
  501:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  502:                     {user, "foo"},
  503:                     short),
  504: 
  505:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  506: 
  507: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  508:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  509: 
  510:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  511:     {error, _} =
  512:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  513:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  514:                     -1),
  515: 
  516:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  517: 
  518: %% All three args incorrect
  519: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  520:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  521: 
  522:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  523:     {error, _} =
  524:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  525:                     {user, "foo"},
  526:                     fortnight),
  527: 
  528:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  529: 
  530: daemon_start(Config) ->
  531:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  532:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  533:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  534:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  535: 
  536:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  537:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  538:                                              {password, "morot"},
  539:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  540:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  541: 
  542: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  543: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  544:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  545:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  546:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  547:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  548:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  549: 
  550: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  551: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  552:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  553:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  554:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  555:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  556:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  557:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  558: 
  559: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  560: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  561:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  562:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  563:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  564: 
  565: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  566: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  567:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  568:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  569:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  570:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  571:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  572: 
  573: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  574: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  575:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  576:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  577:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  578: 
  579: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  580: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  581:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  582:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  583:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  584: 				  "cat", infinity),
  585: 
  586:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  587:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  588:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  589: 
  590:     %% receive response to input
  591:     receive
  592: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  593: 	    ok
  594:     after 
  595: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  596:     end,
  597: 
  598:     %% receive close messages
  599:     receive
  600: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  601: 	    ok
  602:     after 
  603: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  604:     end,
  605:     receive
  606: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  607: 	    ok
  608:     after 
  609: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  610:     end,
  611:     receive
  612: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  613: 	    ok
  614:     after 
  615: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  616:     end.
  617: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  618: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  619:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  620: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  621:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  622:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  623: 				  "cat", infinity),
  624: 
  625:     %% build 10MB binary
  626:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  627: 
  628:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  629:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  630:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  631: 
  632:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  633:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  634: 	{ok, Data} ->
  635: 	    ok;
  636: 	{ok, Other} ->
  637: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  638: 		true ->
  639: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  640: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  641: 		false ->
  642: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  643: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  644: 	    end,
  645: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  646: 	Else ->
  647: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  648:     end,
  649: 
  650:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  651:     receive
  652: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  653: 	    ok 
  654:     after 
  655: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  656:     end,
  657:     receive
  658: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  659: 	    ok
  660:     after 
  661: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  662:     end.
  663: 
  664: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  665: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  666:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  667:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  668:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  669: 
  670:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  671:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  672: 				  "false", infinity),
  673:     receive
  674: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  675: 	    ok
  676:     after 
  677: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  678:     end,
  679:     receive
  680: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  681: 	    ok
  682:     after 
  683: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  684:     end,
  685:     receive
  686: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  687: 	    ok
  688:     after 
  689: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  690:     end,
  691:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  692: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  693: 	ok ->
  694: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  695: 	{error, timeout} ->
  696: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  697: 	Else ->
  698: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  699:     end.
  700: 
  701: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  702: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  703:     Tags =
  704:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  705:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  706:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  707:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  708:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  709:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  710:     Opts =
  711:         lists:zip(Tags,
  712:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  713:     
  714:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  715:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  716:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  717:                 Opts ->
  718:                     ok;
  719:                 Other ->
  720:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  721:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  722:             end;
  723:         Other ->
  724:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  725:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  726:     end.
  727: 
  728: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  729: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  730:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  731:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  732:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  733:                  true -> success;
  734:                  false -> failure
  735:              end,
  736:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  737:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  738: 
  739: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  740: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  741:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  742:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  743:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  744:                  true -> success;
  745:                  false -> failure
  746:              end,
  747:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  748:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  749:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  750: 
  751: 
  752: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  753: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  754:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  755:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  756:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  757:                  true -> success;
  758:                  false -> failure
  759:              end,
  760:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  761:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  762:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  763: 
  764: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  765: %%- small_interrupted_send is interrupted by ssh_echo_server which is
  766: %%  done with transferring data towards client and terminates the
  767: %%  channel (this results with {error, closed} return value from
  768: %%  ssh_connection:send on the client side)
  769: %%- interrupted_send used to be interrupted when ssh_echo_server ran
  770: %%  out of data window and closed channel
  771: %%- but with automatic window adjustment, above condition is not taking
  772: %%  place, so ssh_echo_server continues sending data until it is done
  773: %%- so ssh_connection:send returns 'ok'
  774: small_interrupted_send(Config) ->
  775:     K = 1024,
  776:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  777:     EchoSize = 4 * K,
  778:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, {error, closed}).
  779: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  780:     K = 1024,
  781:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  782:     EchoSize = 4 * K * K,
  783:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, ok).
  784: 
  785: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, SenderResult) ->
  786:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  787:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  788:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  789:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  790:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  791:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  792: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  793: 					     {password, "morot"},
  794: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  795:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  796:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  797: 						      {user, "foo"},
  798: 						      {password, "morot"},
  799: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  800: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  801:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  802:     %% build big binary
  803:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  804:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  805:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  806:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  807:     Parent = self(),
  808:     ResultPid = spawn(
  809: 		  fun() ->
  810: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  811: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  812: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  813: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  814: 			      success ->
  815: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  816: 				  Result =
  817: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  818: 				      of
  819: 					  ExpectedData ->
  820: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  821: 					      ok;
  822: 					  Other ->
  823: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  824: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  825: 				      catch
  826: 					  Class:Exception ->
  827: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  828: 				      end,
  829: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  830: 			      Other ->
  831: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  832: 			  end
  833: 		  end),
  834:     receive
  835: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  836: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  837: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  838: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  839: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  840: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  841: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  842: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  843: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  844: 			      end),
  845: 	    receive
  846: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  847: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  848: 		    {fail, Fail};
  849: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  850: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  851: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  852: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  853: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  854: 		    receive
  855: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  856: 			    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect :)",
  857:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  858: 			    ok;
  859: 			Msg ->
  860: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  861: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  862: 		    end;
  863: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  864: 		    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect, "
  865:                            "but client channel handler has not reported yet",
  866:                            [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  867: 		    receive
  868: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  869: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  870: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  871: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  872: 			    ok;
  873: 			Msg ->
  874: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  875: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  876: 		    end;
  877: 		Msg ->
  878: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  879: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  880: 	    end
  881:     end.
  882: 
  883: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  884: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  885:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  886:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  887:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  888:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  889:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  890: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  891: 					     {password, "morot"},
  892: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  893: 
  894:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  895: 						      {user, "foo"},
  896: 						      {password, "morot"},
  897: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  898: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  899:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
  900:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  901:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  902:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  903: 
  904: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  905: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  906:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
  907:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  908:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  909:                                ],
  910:                        exp_output =>
  911:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  912:                             <<"1> ">>,
  913:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
  914:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  915:                             <<"2> ">>],
  916:                        unexp_output =>
  917:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
  918:                     Config).
  919: 
  920: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  921: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  922:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
  923:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  924:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  925:                                ],
  926:                        exp_output =>
  927:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  928:                             <<"1> ">>,
  929:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n\e[1022D\e[1B">>,
  930:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  931:                             <<"2> ">>,
  932:                             <<"\e[3D\e[J">>,
  933:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
  934:                             <<"\r\n  one_atom_please.">>]},
  935:                     Config).
  936: 
  937: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
  938:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
  939:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
  940:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  941:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  942:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  943:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  944:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  945: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  946: 					     {password, "morot"},
  947:                                              {subsystems, []},
  948:                                              {keepalive, true},
  949:                                              {nodelay, true},
  950:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
  951:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
  952:                                                      end}
  953:                                             ]),
  954:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  955: 						      {user, "foo"},
  956: 						      {password, "morot"},
  957: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  958:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  959:     success =
  960:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
  961:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
  962:                                   infinity),
  963:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
  964:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
  965:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
  966:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
  967:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
  968:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
  969:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
  970: 
  971:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  972:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  973: 
  974: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------
  975: start_shell_pty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->

  981: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},

  983: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  984: 
  985:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  986: 						      {user, "foo"},

  988: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  989: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),

 1000:     file:make_dir(UserDir),

 1005: 					     {exec, {?MODULE,ssh_exec_echo,[]}} ]),

 1008: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1009: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1010: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1011: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1012:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
 1013:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef,  "testing",  <<"echo testing\r\n">>),
 1014:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1015:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).

 1017: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1018: exec_erlang_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1019:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1020:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1021:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1022:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1023:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1024: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1025: 					     {password, "morot"}
 1026:                                             ]),
 1027: 
 1028:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1029: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1030: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1031: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1032: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1033:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
 1034:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
 1035:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1036:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1037:

 1045: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1046: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1047:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end}
 1048:                                             ]),

 1053: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1054: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}
 1055:                                                      ]),

 1102: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1103: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
 1104:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
 1105:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1106:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1107:                                           end)
 1108:                             end,
 1109:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1110:                             Config).
 1111: 
 1112: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
 1113:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
 1114:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1115:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1116:                                           end)
 1117:                             end,
 1118:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
 1119:                             Config).
 1120: 
 1121: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
 1122:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
 1123:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1124:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1125:                                           end)
 1126:                             end,
 1127:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
 1128:                             Config).
 1129: 
 1130: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
 1131:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
 1132:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1133:                             Config).
 1134: 
 1135: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
 1136:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1137:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1138:                             Config).
 1139: 
 1140: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1141:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1142:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1143:                             Config).
 1144: 
 1145: start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data(Config) ->
 1146:     N = 60000,
 1147:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1148:     ReceiveFun =
 1149:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, _Expect, _ExpectType) ->
 1150:                 receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1151:                               N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1152:         end,
 1153:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct,
 1154:                              fun(_Cmd) ->
 1155:                                      {ok,
 1156:                                       [io_lib:format("testing~n",[]) ||
 1157:                                           _ <- lists:seq(1, N)]}
 1158:                              end},
 1159:                             "not_relevant", <<"not_used\n">>, 0,
 1160:                             ReceiveFun,
 1161:                             Config).
 1162: 
 1163: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1164:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1165:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1166:                             Config).
 1167: 
 1168: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1169:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1170:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1171:                             Config).
 1172: 
 1173: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1174:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1175:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1176:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1177:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1178:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1179: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1180: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1181: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1182: 
 1183:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1184:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1185:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1186:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1187:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1188: 
 1189:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1190: 
 1191:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1192:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1193: 
 1194:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1195:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1196:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1197: 
 1198:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1199:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1200:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1201:     receive
 1202:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1203:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1204:     end,
 1205:     receive
 1206:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1207:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1208:     end,
 1209:     receive
 1210:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1211:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1212:     end,
 1213:     receive
 1214:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1215:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1216:     after 0 -> go_on
 1217:     end,
 1218:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1219: 
 1220: 
 1221: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1222:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1223:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1224:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1225:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1226:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1227: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1228: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1229: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1230: 
 1231:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1232:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1233:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1234:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1235:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1236: 
 1237:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1238: 
 1239:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1240:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1241: 
 1242:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1243:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1244:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1245: 
 1246:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1247:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1248:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1249:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1250:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1251:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\n">>}}),
 1252:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1253:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1254:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1255:     receive
 1256:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1257:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1258:     end,
 1259:     receive
 1260:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1261:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1262:     end,
 1263:     receive
 1264:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1265:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1266:     end,
 1267:     receive
 1268:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1269:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1270:     after 0 -> go_on
 1271:     end,
 1272:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1273: 
 1274: 
 1275: 
 1276:     
 1277: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1278: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1279:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1280:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1281: 
 1282: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1283:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1284:         {ok, quit} ->
 1285:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1286:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1287:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1288:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1289:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1290:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1291:     end.
 1292:     
 1293: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1294: 
 1295: 
 1296: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1297:     DefaultReceiveFun =
 1298:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType) ->
 1299:                 receive
 1300:                     {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1301:                         ok
 1302:                 after 5000 ->
 1303:                         receive
 1304:                             Other ->
 1305:                                 ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1306:                                        [Other,
 1307:                                         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 1308:                                          {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1309:                                          %% {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1310:                                 ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1311:                         after 0 ->
 1312:                                 ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1313:                         end
 1314:                 end
 1315:         end,
 1316:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, DefaultReceiveFun, Config).
 1317: 
 1318: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, ReceiveFun, Config) ->
 1319:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1320:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1321:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1322:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1323:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1324: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1325: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1326: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1327: 
 1328:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1329: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1330: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1331: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1332: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1333: 
 1334:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1335:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Command, infinity),
 1336:     ReceiveFun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType),
 1337:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1338:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1339: 
 1340: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1341: %% Issue GH-8223
 1342: trap_exit_connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1343:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1344:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1345:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1346:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1347:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1348:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1349:                                              {password, "morot"}]),
 1350:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1351:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1352:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1353: 
 1354:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1355:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1356:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1357:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1358:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1359:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1360:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1361:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1362: 
 1363:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1364:     receive
 1365:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1366:     after 0 ->
 1367:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1368:     end.
 1369: 
 1370: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1371: %% Issue GH-8223
 1372: trap_exit_daemon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1373:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1374:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1375:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1376:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1377: 
 1378:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1379:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1380:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1381: 
 1382:     {ok, DaemonRef} = ssh:daemon(0, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1383:                                      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1384:     ssh:stop_daemon(DaemonRef),
 1385: 
 1386:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1387:     receive
 1388:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1389:     after 0 ->
 1390:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1391:     end.
 1392: 
 1393: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1394: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1395:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1396:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1397:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1398:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1399:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1400:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1401:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1402:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1403:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1404: 
 1405:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1406:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1407:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1408: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1409: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1410: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1411: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1412: 
 1413:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1414: 
 1415:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1416: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1417: 
 1418:     receive
 1419: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1420: 	    ok
 1421:     after 5000 ->
 1422: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1423:     end,
 1424: 
 1425:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1426:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1427: 
 1428: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1429: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1430:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1431:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1432:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1433:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1434: 
 1435:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1436:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1437:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1438: 
 1439:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1440:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1441: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1442: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1443: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1444: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1445: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1446: 	       end),
 1447: 
 1448:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1449:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1450:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1451:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1452: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1453: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1454: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1455: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1456: 
 1457:     %% And runs some commands
 1458:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1459: 
 1460:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1461: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1462: 
 1463:     receive
 1464: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1465: 	    ok
 1466:     after 5000 ->
 1467: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1468:     end,
 1469: 
 1470:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1471: 
 1472: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1473: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1474:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1475:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1476:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1477:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1478: 
 1479:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1480: 
 1481:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1482:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1483:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1484: 
 1485:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1486:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1487:                   {password, "morot"},
 1488:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1489: 
 1490:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1491:     Pids =
 1492:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1493:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1494:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1495:                     end)
 1496:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1497:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1498: 
 1499:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1500:     ConnectionRefs =
 1501:         [begin
 1502:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1503:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1504:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1505:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1506:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1507:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1508:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1509:              ConnectionRef
 1510:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1511:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1512: 
 1513:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1514:     Parent = self(),
 1515:     ClientPids =
 1516:         lists:map(
 1517:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1518:                   spawn_link(
 1519:                     fun() ->
 1520:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1521:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1522:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1523:                             receive
 1524:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1525:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1526:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1527:                             after 5000 ->
 1528:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1529:                             end
 1530:                     end)
 1531:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1532:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1533: 
 1534:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1535:                           receive
 1536:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1537:                           end
 1538:                   end, ClientPids),
 1539:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1540: 
 1541:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1542: 
 1543: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1544: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1545:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1546:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1547:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1548:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1549:     
 1550:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1551:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1552:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1553: 
 1554:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1555:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1556:     receive
 1557: 	Verstring ->
 1558: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1559: 	    receive
 1560: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1561: 		    ok
 1562: 	    end
 1563:     after 
 1564: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1565:     end.
 1566: 
 1567: gracefull_invalid_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1568:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),

 1573:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},

 1579: 	Verstring ->
 1580: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),

 1583: 		    ok
 1584: 	    end
