 1634: kex_error(Config) ->
 1635:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1636:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1637:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1638:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1639:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1640:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1641:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1642:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1643:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1644:                                              ]),
 1645:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1646:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1647:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1648:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1649:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1650:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1651:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1652:                                    ok % Other msg
 1653:                            end,
 1654:                            self()),
 1655:     try
 1656:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1657:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1658:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1659:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1660:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1661:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1662:                                          ])
 1663:     of
 1664:         _ ->
 1665:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1666:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1667:     catch
 1668:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1669:             %% ok
 1670:             receive
 1671:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1672:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1673:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1674:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1675:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1676:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1677:                                      "Details:",
 1678:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1679:                                      "we have:",
 1680:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1681:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1682:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1683:                     case OK of
 1684:                         true ->
 1685:                             ok;
 1686:                         false ->
 1687:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1688:                     end
 1689:             after 20000 ->
 1690:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1691:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1692:             end;
 1693: 
 1694:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1695:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1696:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1697:     end.
 1698: 
 1699: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1700:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1701:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1702:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1703:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1704:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1705: 
 1706:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1707: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1708: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1709: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1710: 
 1711:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1712:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1713:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1714:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1715:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1716:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1717:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1718:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1719: 
 1720:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1721: 
 1722:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1723:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1724:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1725: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1726: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1727: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1728: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1729:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1730: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1731:     receive
 1732: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1733:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1734: 	    ok
 1735:     after 5000 ->
 1736: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1737:     end,
 1738: 
 1739:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1740:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1741:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1742:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1743: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1744: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1745:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1746:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1747:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1748:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1749:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1750: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1751:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1752:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1753:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1754:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1755:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1756: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1757: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1758: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1759: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1760: 	Error ->
 1761: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1762: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1763: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1764:     end.
 1765: 
 1766: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1767:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1768:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1769:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1770:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1771: 
 1772:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1773:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1774:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1775:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1776:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1777:     Collect = 
 1778:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1779:                 receive
 1780:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1781:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1782:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1783:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1784:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1785:                 after 100 ->
 1786:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1787:                 end
 1788:         end,
 1789:  
 1790:     %% Install the test handler:
 1791:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1792:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1793:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1794:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1795:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1796:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1797:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1798:                                    ok
 1799:                            end,
 1800:                            self()),
 1801: 
 1802:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1803: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1804: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1805: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1806: 
 1807:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1808: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1809: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1810: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1811: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1812:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1813:     [true|_] =
 1814:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1815:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1816:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1817:     
 1818:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1819:     timer:sleep(500),
 1820:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1821:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1822: 
 1823:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1824:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1825:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1826:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1827:     end.
 1828:     
 1829: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1830:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1831:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1832:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1833:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1834:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1835: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1836: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1837: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1838: 
 1839:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1840: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1841: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1842: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1843: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1844: 
 1845: 
 1846:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1847:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1848:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1849:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1850:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1851:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1852: 
 1853:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1854:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1855:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1856:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1857:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1858:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1859:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1860:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1861: 
 1862:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1863:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1864: 
 1865: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1866: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1867:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1868:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1869:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1870:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1871:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1872: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1873: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1874: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1875: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1876: 					    ]),
 1877: 
 1878:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1879: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1880: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1881: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1882: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1883: 
 1884:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1885:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1886:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1887:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1888:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1889:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1890:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1891:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1892:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1893:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1894: 
 1895:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1896:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1897: 
 1898:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1899:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1900:     receive
 1901: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1902: 	    ok
 1903:     after 5000 ->
 1904: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1905:     end,
 1906: 
 1907:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1908:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1909: 
 1910:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1911:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1912:     receive
 1913: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1914: 	    ok
 1915:     after 5000 ->
 1916: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1917:     end,
 1918: 
 1919:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1920:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1921: 
 1922:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1923:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1924: 
 1925:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1926:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1927:     
 1928:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1929:     receive
 1930: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1931:     after 5000 ->
 1932: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1933: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1934: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1935: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1936:     end,
 1937: 
 1938:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1939:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1940: 
 1941:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1942:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1943: 
 1944:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1945:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1946: 
 1947: handler_down_before_open(Config) ->
 1948:     %% Start echo subsystem with a delay in init() - until a signal is received
 1949:     %% One client opens a channel on the connection
 1950:     %% the other client requests the echo subsystem on the second channel and then immediately goes down
 1951:     %% the test monitors the client and when receiving 'DOWN' signals 'echo' to proceed
 1952:     %% a) there should be no crash after 'channel-open-confirmation'
 1953:     %% b) there should be proper 'channel-close' exchange
 1954:     %% c) the 'exec' channel should not be affected after the 'echo' channel goes down
 1955:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1956:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1957:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1958:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1959:     Parent = self(),
 1960:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [8, [{dbg, true}, {parent, Parent}]]},
 1961:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1962: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1963: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1964: 					     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1},
 1965: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
 1966:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1967:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1968: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1969: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1970: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1971: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1972:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1973: 
 1974:     ExecChannelPid = spawn(
 1975:         fun() ->
 1976:             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1977: 
 1978:             %% This is to get peer's connection handler PID ({conn_peer ...} below) and suspend it
 1979:             {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1980:             ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1981:             ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1982:             receive
 1983:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {closed, 1}} -> ok
 1984:             end,
 1985: 
 1986:             Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId0},
 1987:             Result = receive
 1988:                 cmd ->
 1989:                     ct:log("~p:~p Channel ~p executing", [?MODULE, ?LINE, ChannelId0]),
 1990:                     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1991:                     Expect = <<"echo testing\n">>,
 1992:                     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1993:                     receive
 1994:                         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0,
 1995:                                                  <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 1996:                             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE, R]),
 1997:                             ok;
 1998:                         Other ->
 1999:                             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2000:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 2001:                                                            {data, ChannelId0, 0, Expect}}]),
 2002:                             {fail, "Unexpected data"}
 2003:                     after 5000 ->
 2004:                             {fail, "Exec Timeout"}
 2005:                     end;
 2006:                     stop -> {fail, "Stopped"}
 2007:             end,
 2008:             Parent ! {self(), Result}
 2009:       end),
 2010:     try
 2011:         TestResult = receive
 2012:             {ExecChannelPid, channelId, ExId} ->
 2013:                 ct:log("~p:~p Channel that should stay: ~p pid ~p", [?MODULE, ?LINE, ExId, ExecChannelPid]),
 2014:                 ConnPeer = receive {conn_peer, CM} -> CM end,
 2015:                 %% The sole purpose of this channel is to go down before the opening procedure is complete
 2016:                 DownChannelPid = spawn(
 2017:                     fun() ->
 2018:                         ct:log("~p:~p open channel (incomplete)",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
 2019:                         Parent ! {self(), channelId, ok},
 2020:                         %% This is to prevent the peer from answering our 'channel-open' in time
 2021:                         sys:suspend(ConnPeer),
 2022:                         {ok, _ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2023:                         ct:log("~p:~p open incomplete channel done - should not have happened",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
 2024:                         Parent ! {self(), {fail, "Unexpected channel success"}}
 2025:                     end),
 2026:                 MonRef = erlang:monitor(process, DownChannelPid),
 2027:                 receive
 2028:                     {DownChannelPid, channelId, ok} ->
 2029:                         ct:log("~p:~p Channel handler that won't continue: pid ~p", [?MODULE, ?LINE, DownChannelPid]),
 2030:                         ensure_channels(ConnectionRef, 2),
 2031:                         channel_down_sequence(DownChannelPid, ExecChannelPid, ExId, MonRef, ConnectionRef, ConnPeer)
 2032:                 end
 2033:         end,
 2034:         ensure_channels(ConnectionRef, 0)
 2035:     after
 2036:         ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 2037:         ssh:stop_daemon(Pid)
 2038:     end.
 2039: 
 2040: ensure_channels(ConnRef, Expected) ->
 2041:     {ok, ChannelList} = ssh_connection_handler:info(ConnRef),
 2042:     do_ensure_channels(ConnRef, Expected, length(ChannelList)).
 2043: 
 2044: do_ensure_channels(_ConnRef, NumExpected, NumExpected) ->
 2045:     ok;
 2046: do_ensure_channels(ConnRef, NumExpected, _ChannelListLen) ->
 2047:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 2048:     {ok, ChannelList} = ssh_connection_handler:info(ConnRef),
 2049:     do_ensure_channels(ConnRef, NumExpected, length(ChannelList)).
 2050: 
 2051: channel_down_sequence(DownChannelPid, ExecChannelPid, ExecChannelId, MonRef, ConnRef, Peer) ->
 2052:     ct:log("~p:~p sending order to go down", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
 2053:     exit(DownChannelPid, die),
 2054:     receive {'DOWN', MonRef, _, _, _} -> ok end,
 2055:     ct:log("~p:~p order executed, sending order to proceed", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
 2056:     %% Resume the peer connection to let it clean up among its channels
 2057:     sys:resume(Peer),
 2058:     ensure_channels(ConnRef, 1),
 2059:     ExecChannelPid ! cmd,
 2060:     try
 2061:         receive
 2062:             {ExecChannelPid, ok} ->
 2063:                 ct:log("~p:~p expected exec result: ~p", [?MODULE, ?LINE, ok]),
 2064:                 ok;
 2065:             {ExecChannelPid, Result} ->
 2066:                 ct:log("~p:~p Unexpected exec result: ~p", [?MODULE, ?LINE, Result]),
 2067:                 {fail, "Unexpected exec result"}
 2068:         after 5000 ->
 2069:             {fail, "Exec result timeout"}
 2070:         end
 2071:     after
 2072:         ssh_connection:close(ConnRef, ExecChannelId)
 2073:     end.
 2074: 
 2075: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2076: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 2077: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2078: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 2079:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 1).
 2080: 
 2081: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, N) ->
 2082:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2083:     Cmd = "yes testing | head -n " ++ integer_to_list(N),
 2084:     ct:log("Cmd to be invoked over SSH shell: ~p", [Cmd]),
 2085:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Cmd, infinity),
 2086:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 2087:     case N of
 2088:         1 ->
 2089:             %% receive response to input
 2090:             receive
 2091:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, ExpectedBin}} ->
 2092:                     ok
 2093:             after
 2094:                 10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2095:             end;
 2096:         _ ->
 2097:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 2098:     end,
 2099: 
 2100:     %% receive close messages
 2101:     receive
 2102: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 2103: 	    ok
 2104:     after
 2105: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2106:     end,
 2107:     receive
 2108: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 2109: 	    ok
 2110:     after
 2111: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2112:     end,
 2113:     receive
 2114: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 2115: 	    ok
 2116:     after
 2117: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2118:     end.
 2119: 
 2120: 
 2121: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2122: flush_msgs() ->
 2123:     flush_msgs([]).
 2124: 
 2125: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 2126:     receive
 2127:         M ->
 2128:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 2129:                 true ->
 2130:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 2131:                 _ ->
 2132:                     flush_msgs()
 2133:             end
 2134:     after
 2135:         500 -> ok
 2136:     end.
 2137: 
 2138: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2139: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2140:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 2141: 
 2142: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 2143:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2144:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 2145:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2146:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 2147:     receive
 2148:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2149:             flush_msgs();
 2150: 
 2151:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2152:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 2153: 
 2154:         R ->
 2155:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2156:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 2157:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 2158: 
 2159:     after 5000 ->
 2160:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 2161:     end.
 2162: 
 2163: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2164: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2165:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2166:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 2167:     receive
 2168:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 2169:             flush_msgs();
 2170:         R ->
 2171:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2172:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 2173:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 2174:     after 5000 ->
 2175:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 2176:     end.
 2177: 
 2178: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2179: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2180:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 2181: 
 2182: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 2183:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 2184: 
 2185: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 2186:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2187:     case PtyOpts of
 2188:         [] ->
 2189:             no_alloc;
 2190:         _ ->
 2191:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 2192:     end,
 2193:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 2194: 
 2195:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2196:     receive
 2197: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2198: 	    flush_msgs();
 2199: 
 2200:         R ->
 2201:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2202:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 2203:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 2204: 
 2205:     after 5000 ->
 2206: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 2207:     end.
 2208: 
 2209: 
 2210: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2211:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 2212: 
 2213: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 2214:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2215:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 2216:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2217:     receive
 2218:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0,
 2219:                                  <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 2220:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 2221:         Other ->
 2222:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2223:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 2224:                                            {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}}]),
 2225:             {fail, "Unexpected data"}
 2226:     after 5000 ->
 2227:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 2228:     end.
 2229: 
 2230: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 2231: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 2232:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 2233: 
 2234: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 2235:     receive
 2236: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 2237: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 2238: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2239: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 2240:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 2241: 	    timeout
 2242:     end.
 2243: 
 2244: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 2245:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",
 2246:            [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 2247:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 2248: 
 2249: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 2250:     TO = 5000,
 2251:     receive
 2252: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 2253: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2254: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 2255: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 2256: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2257: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2258: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 2259: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2260: 	Msg ->
 2261: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 2262: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2263:     after TO ->
 2264: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 2265: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2266:     end.
 2267: 
 2268: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 2269:     try
 2270: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 2271:     of
 2272: 	Bin ->
 2273: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2274: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 2275: 	    Bin
 2276:     catch
 2277: 	C:E ->
 2278: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 2279: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 2280: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 2281:     end.
 2282: 
 2283: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 2284: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 2285: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 2286:     spawn(fun() ->
 2287: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 2288: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 2289:           end).
 2290: 
 2291: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 2292:     spawn(fun() ->
 2293:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 2294:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 2295:           end).
 2296: 
 2297: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 2298:     spawn(fun() ->
 2299:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 2300:           end).
 2301: 
 2302: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 2303:     spawn(fun() ->
 2304:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 2305:           end).
 2306: 
 2307: receive_bytes(_, _, 0, _) ->
 2308:     ct:log("ALL DATA RECEIVED Budget = 0"),
 2309:     ct:log("================================ ExpectBudget = 0 (reception completed)"),
 2310:     ok;
 2311: receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Budget, AccSize) when Budget > 0 ->
 2312:     receive
 2313:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, D}} ->
 2314:             Fmt = "================================ ExpectBudget = "
 2315:                 "~p bytes Received/Total = ~p/~p bytes",
 2316:             Args = [Budget, byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D)],
 2317:             ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2318:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 2319:                           Budget - byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D))
 2320:     after
 2321:         10000 ->
 2322:             ct:log("process_info(self(), messages) = ~p",
 2323:                    [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 2324:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2325:     end.
